title: Albóndigas Soup with Cilantro Pesto
ingredients: 2 ripe tomatoes, peeled, seeded and diced
½ cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
1 fresh mint sprig, stemmed and chopped
instructions: Place the rice in a heatproof bowl.  Bring the water to a boil and pour it over the rice.  Let it soak for 40 minutes, then drain and set it aside.
Meanwhile, in a frying pan over medium heat, warm 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil.  Add 1 of the onions and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes.  Remove from the heat and let it cool.

In a bowl, combine the pork, beef, cooled onion, soaked rice, egg, cumin, oregano, ¾ teaspoon of the salt, and ½ teaspoon of the pepper.  Using your hands, mix well and fashion the meatballs, approximately 1-inch in size.

In a large soup pot over medium heat, arm the remaining 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.  Add the remaining onion and sauté until soft, about 5 minutes.  Add the garlic, carrots, and tomatoes and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 5 minutes.  Add the chicken stock, stir well and bring to a boil.  Carefully slip the meatballs into the pot, reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered until the meatballs are fully cooked, about 45 minutes.  Stir in the remaining ¾ teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper.
While the soup is simmering make the cilantro pesto.  In a food processor, or blender, combine the cilantro, mint, lime juice, olive oil, water, and salt.  Process to a paste.
Ladle the soup into warmed soup bowls and top each serving with a dollop of cilantro pesto.
Source:  Cantina, The Best of Casual Mexican Cooking by Susan Feniger and Mary Sue Milliken, © 1996 by Weldon Owen Inc., published by Sunset Publishing Corp., Menlo Park, CA 94025.
